comment.body: @Wire: An old film from 1995.
ZeroNet is not Tor.
Ayaya!

`/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit`
`/ZeroMedia.bit`
You are just one slash way.
There is no private data in the P2P architecture, since every part of what you see is shared by everyone. The content of ZeroMail is also shared by everyone, but encrypted.
Freenet, IPFS...
nofish
Bwoi Analytic
@Sick Bird: Bwoi Analytic is planned, but the [site](/bwoi.bit) has not been updated since the end of last month.
Why not add a Let's Encrypt certificate?
@RiotPulv: I don't think you have to include your port in the certificate. (e.g. https://5.101.103.222:43110/ https://bit.no.com:43110)
ZeroRevision: Free, Decentralized and Anonymous essay proofread service.
Active probing of Chinese National Firewall (?)
A LOT OF people use this.
@Bravo: This is the Firefox iframe bug. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1293316
You can use ZeroNet in Tor Browser to register for a ZeroID.

If ignoring a complaint makes the whole server go down, I would choose to take down that .bit address. (Before deleting it, put it onto other proxies).


but you can also download another copy of ZeroNet onto your VPS and configure that copy of ZeroNet to always use Tor.
@Border0464fred: That Q9 thing seems to be a commercial sh*t made by a Hong Kong company. MRL's proxy is in Japan. Both places comply to DMCA requests.
GNURoot
When you are not using `target='_top'`, the link will be opened in ZeroNet's sandbox. Using `target='_blank'` will not make the GitHub page escape the sandbox.
Hello Microsoft Office

Hi, you should place the `loader` folder onto your ZeroNet site, so you can get something like this:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiD...........nw2V/loader/?1bSVKz4d
Only in this way can we have access to your shared files.

@Bullseye: Find your `loader` folder. It is in your unpacked ZeroMux Bundle.
Copy the whole `loader` folder to your site: `ZeroBundle\ZeroNet\data\1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR\`
Then you can share a link like this:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?1bSVKz4d

On my ZeroNet, I didn't see your site updated. Make sure you **sign and publish** your site, and have your port opened.
Go to your site, drag the `0` button all the way to the left. You will see a side bar. Scroll to the bottom. Click "sign," **wait for 10 seconds**. Then click "publish."
@Apuar: He forgot to **sign and publish**.
@Bullseye: Help me check this: Go to your unpacked **ZeroMux Bundle**, then go to `loader\files\`. Can you see a folder named after your PDF file?

@Bullseye: You forgot to copy all of your files. Copy your `loader` folder to your site again, replacing old files.
Then "sign" and "publish"
@Bullseye: Sign and publish, please. You must go through this step after you modify your site. Signing is for data integrity.
~~We might have to wait until he realized that he has to sign.~~

Here are some ZeroNet Gateways: 
https://bit.no.com:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?1emUNJzG
https://onlyzero.net/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?1emUNJzG
https://zerogate.tk/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?1emUNJzG

It seems that you don't have your port opened. After you clicked on **publish**, load your site immediately on one of these gateways.
Did you lost your key?

@Bullseye: Don't reinstall ZeroNet, otherwise you may lose your private key. Your private key is in `data\users.json`. If you switch to your old ZeroNet client, you won't be prompt to enter your private key.
@Bullseye: Then find your private key and paste it into that box.

@Bullseye: Since you have your site updated, download your file from this [gateway](https://bit.no.com:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?1bSVKz4d). At the same time, click on Publish at your own ZeroNet client.
Stop wizard.py. Go to your loader folder, delete `files\` and start wizard.py again.

For those who are using ZeroMux Bundle:
You may have noticed that, you can't delete files, yet,
because I am still writing this. I guess it will come out next week.

For this week, you can make a temporary Trash folder for your unwanted files. Sorry about that.
@Bullseye: Try [this](https://bit.no.com:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/) first. Does it look the same as what you saw on your own computer?
First check `data\1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR\loader\files\`
@Bullseye: Just describe it.
@Bullseye: Now **sign** your site first. When it is done, click **publish**. I will help you load your site onto the proxy.
Very weird things occurred. Your site does not include these files.
http://127.0.0.1:18905/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/ check this link.

@Bullseye: Copy your `loader` folder to your site, please. Remember to delete your old `loader` folder.

There is some tech stuff you need to know about:
```
127.0.0.1:43110 is ZeroNet
127.0.0.1:18905 is Wizard.py
```
```
Your two `loader` folders do not synchronize automatically.
```

After you modified your site, you have to sign and publish, otherwise we can't see your site updated.
@Bullseye: Sign and publish.

First try http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?13vL1Ugz

Then https://bit.no.com:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?13vL1Ugz
@Bullseye: **On your own ZeroNet client,** Drag the `0` button all the way to the left. Press Sign and Publish
@Bullseye: I mean don't sign your things on the gateway.
@Bullseye: Sign and publish your site. Then check the gateway https://bit.no.com:43110/1PE5GTgUjKVQuudoz4P1YCrmZPVXvZwRmR/loader/?13vL1Ugz
Can I see the full name of your `bit_by_bit` folder?

I think the brackets `[]` caused problems. Can you:
1. rename your folder to `bit_by_bit`
2. edit `list.json` (copy paste)
```
{"files": [{"fileJson": "files/bit_to_bit/file.json", "id": "11UxTrsu", "fileName": "Bit by Bit How P2P Is Freeing the World (2015) by Jeffrey Tucker, Roger Ver, Patrick Byrne.pdf"}], "folders": [{"type": "filePointer", "id": "11UxTrsu"}]}
```
3. sign and publish

It should work if you have done it correctly.
